description: Borrowed from Latin indignans, present participle of indignari (“to consider as unworthy, be angry or displeased at”), from in- (“privative”) + dignari (“to consider as worthy”), from dignus (“worthy”).

adjectives.description: indignant (comparative more indignant, superlative most indignant)

entries.meaning: Showing anger or indignation, especially at something unjust or wrong.
